topic.title: Notes, Cautions, and Warnings

row.entry: A Note indicates important information that helps you make better use of your system.
A Caution indicates potential damage to hardware or loss of data if instructions are not followed.
A Warning indicates a potential for property damage, personal injury, or death.

body.p: This document is for informational purposes only and may contain typographical errors and technical inaccuracies. The content is provided as is, without express or implied warranties of any kind.

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
topic.title: Overview

body.p: This guide provides information necessary to deploy the Dell Red Hat Cloud Solutions with Red Hat Enterprise Linux OpenStack Platform 5, on Dell R620, R720, and R720xd servers with Dell PowerEdge H710 disk controller; and the network with Dell Force10 S4810 and the S55 Switches.

section.title: Intended Audience
section.p: This guide assumes the reader is familiar with:

ul.li: PowerEdge R620 and R720xd RAID and BIOS configuration

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
topic.title: Configuring R620, R720, and R720xd Hardware

body.p:
This section describes manually configuring Dell R720 and the Dell R720xd server hardware for the Dell Red Hat Cloud Solutions with Red Hat Enterprise Linux OpenStack Platform:
IPMI Configuration
BIOS Configuration
RAID Configuration

section.title: IPMI Configuration
section.p: You must perform configuration of the iDRAC on supported systems. Dell recommends that you configure these settings from the iDRAC web interface, or directly on the node console.

ol.li: Set credentials for the root user including changing the password to a new one based on good password standards.
Set privileges for the user to Admin level privileges including over LAN.
Sets the iDRAC IP address, subnet mask, default gateway IP, and default VLAN (id is 10).
Sets the iDRAC IP address source to be static IP addressing.
Sets the iDRAC NIC mode to Dedicated from Shared

section.title: Validating Server IPMI Configuration
section.p: As part of the IPMI setup, validation that remote commands can be executed is essential.

ol.li:
Install to your workstation the IPMI Utilities from SourceForge:
For Linux - http://sourceforge.net/projects/ipmitool/
For Windows - http://ipmiutil.sourceforge.net/
Validate that you have all the requirements, and that it will run.
Plug your Ethernet port into a switch port that has the same vLAN as your iDRACs.
Configure your network to use an IP address in the iDRAC network range.
Configure the IPMI over LAN Setting to Enabled.

Execute an IPMI command:
for i in $(seq 162 170); do ipmitool –P “password” –U “username” –H 192.168.200.$i power status; done
This will perform a simple, non-destructive poll of the iDRAC from 192.168.200.162 to 192.168.200.170, and then return the power status of on or off.
You can replace the keyword status with reset, off, or on.
Ensure that all machines return responses to the command.

section.title: Infrastructure and Virtualization Node Settings
section.p: This section describes the settings for nodes that will be used on the Solution Admin Host, OpenStack controllers, and Compute nodes. For the R620 the settings below need to be double-checked.

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
topic.title: EqualLogic Storage Group

body.p: The EqualLogic Storage Group can consist of one or more storage arrays with one or more storage groups. The configuration of the arrays is beyond the scope of this document. Please refer to EqualLogic Support Website (https://eqlsupport.dell.com/secure/login.aspx) for the latest guides, whitepapers and best practices on how to setup your Storage Group for your application.

Once the Storage Group(s) are setup, the information contained in Table 4 must be collected to configure your software. The san_thin_provision variable should be left at the default if available; if not, then it must be set to False. Refer to https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-US/Red_Hat_Enterprise_Linux_OpenStack_Platform/5/html/Configuration_Reference_Guide/section_volume-drivers.html#dell-equallogic-driver for the current list.

row.entry: IP address used to reach the EqualLogic Group through SSH
User name to login to the Group manager via SSH at the san_ip
Password to login to the Group manager via SSH at the san_ip (not used when san_private_key is set)
Timeout value, in seconds, used by CLI commands over SSH
Filename of the private key used for SSH authentication
Minimum number of SSH connections in the pool
Maximum number of SSH connections in the pool
Password for specified CHAP account name
Timeout for the Group Manager CLI command execution
Group name to use for creating volumes
Pool in which volumes will be created

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
topic.title: Network Configuration

body.p: If you are not using Dell Force 10 S55 and/or S4810 switches, you will need to program the switches to support your cloud instantiation. Your switches are expected to support the following:

ul.li: Support for IEEE 802.1Q vLAN traffic and port tagging
Support using one untagged and multiple tagged vLANs on the same port

Ability to provide a minimum of 170 Gigabit Ethernet ports in a non-blocking configuration within Provisioning vLAN
Configuration can be a single switch or a combination of stacked switches to meet the additional requirements
The ability to create link aggregation groups (LAGs) with a minimum of two physical links in each LAG

If multiple switches are stacked:
The ability to create a LAG across stacked switches
Full-bisection bandwidth
Support for vLANs to be available across all switches in the stack
A managed switch that supports SSH and serial line configuration

section.title: Configuring the Dell Force 10 S55 and/or S4810

body.p: The bundle workbooks are designed to help configure the cluster. Follow the steps outlined to setup your network.

ol.li:
Fill each workbook page with all information marked required:
On the switch config page fill in each device name, NIC connected to port.
Using your planning sheet and vLAN information, mark which vlan is either untagged or tagged for each port connected. Not all vLAN will be used on each port.

Using the workbook you can now create your configuration:
Individual Port Config Example for S55no ip address portmode hybrid switchport spanning-tree rstp edge-port
Individual Port Config example for S4810no ip address portmode hybrid switchport flowcontrol rx on tx off spanning-tree rstp edge-port
Configuring vLANs. With option portmode hybrid on each port, you can program one vLAN to be untagged and other vLANs as tagged. This will send all untagged traffic to the vLAN that is marked untagged. For example, DHCP Request will be placed on that vLAN, and a DHCP server listening on that vLAN will be able to respond.
Example vLAN config with overlapping tagged and untagged ports:nt vlan 100 no ip address ! From your Spread Sheet tagged TenGigabitEthernet 0/1 - 47 untagged TenGigabitEthernet 0/0 ! int vlan 200 tagged TenGigabitEthernet 0/0-47 int vlan 300 untagged TenGigabitEther 0/1-10 ! ! int vlan 300 tagged TenGigabitEthernet 0/0-47 int vlan 300 untagged TenGigabitEther 0/1-10 !
General switch options for the S55 and S4810:! hostname YOUR_HOSTNAME ! username Tome password 7 MYpassword 1 privilege 15 ! protocol spanning-tree rstp no disable hello-time 1 max-age 6 forward-delay 4 bridge-priority 16384 ! no ip telnet server enable ! arp learn-enable ! clock timezone EST -5 ! ip ssh server enable ! protocol lldp advertise dot1-tlv port-protocol-vlan-id advertise dot3-tlv max-frame-size advertise management-tlv system-description system-name advertise med no disable ! reload-type normal-reload !
How to create a VLT Domain on the S4810:! vlt domain 899 peer-link port-channel 100 primary-priority 4096 unit-id 0 ! ! interface Port-channel 100 description Connection to VLT peer no ip address channel-member fortyGigE 0/48 no shutdown !

body.note: You do not need to add the port-channel or the vlt to a vLAN. All vLANs will be passed on it.

topic.title: References

body.p: Additional information can be obtained at http://www.dell.com/openstack or by e-mailing openstack@dell.com.
If you need additional services or implementation help, please contact your Dell sales representative.
For more information on the Dell Red Hat Cloud Solutions with Red Hat Enterprise Linux OpenStack Platform visit http://www.dell.com/openstack.
